events.message: The customer filed a claim reporting their car was involved in a rear-end collision at an intersection yesterday afternoon.
Claim has been categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords found in the initial report and damage description.
An agent from the auto claims department was assigned to handle the claim and provide guidance to the policyholder.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment message to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
Customer was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of the driver’s license for claim processing.
All requested documents including accident photos and the official police report were submitted by the customer promptly today.
The claims examiner has begun a formal investigation to assess the damages and circumstances surrounding the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded after reviewing all evidence; damage assessment and liability have been verified for this case.
A settlement offer was formulated and sent to the claimant based on the repair cost estimates and coverage terms.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the handling of the claim.
Approval for the claim was granted and a final confirmation was sent out to the customer with payment details.
The insurance payment for vehicle repair was issued and transferred to the customer’s designated bank account today.
The claim was officially closed after payment was confirmed and no further actions were required from either party.
